channel.title: Amarok
channel.description:
[img]http://amarok.kde.org/sites/default/themes/amarok/logo.png[/img]
Amarok is the best media player I have ever used. Initially, it was developed for the K User Environment (KDE), but since then it has moved to more mainstream operating systems such as Windows. A full list of supported Distributions & operating systems can be found: [code]http://amarok.kde.org/wiki/Download[/code]
Amarok 2.0: [img]http://amarok.kde.org/files/Amarok-2_0_0-Overview_1.png[/img]
I'd avoid this due to the amount of bugs found in this version, not to mention the cluttered GUI.
Amarok 1.4-1.5: [img]http://amarok.kde.org/files/amarok14/shot7.png[/img]
This version; however, is much more stable and is clean cut. I use it myself.
Hope I've shared some well-designed, open source software with this community.
PS: The source code is available for download on the site.

item.title: Amarok
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Niall:

I’ve tried Amarok before but it just looked too bloated compared to what I usually use. (Winamp classic/xmms)

Xmms is great for a simple player; but if you have a huge library like me - organization is key ;D.

Read full topic

item.title: Amarok
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:12, topic:264681”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=349481.msg2693029#msg2693029 date=1236083972]

itunes > *

you seem to have your sign the wrong way round, it should look like this
itunes < * < Winamp
[/quote]

iTunes is a brilliant program, far better than winamp.[/quote]
yeah sure itunes is better if you’re the sort of person who thinks the pyramids would look good with neon strips running down the side

Read full topic

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Seriously? I haven’t used winamp in years, so I can’t comment there. But I had to use iTunes recently and it was one of the worst programs I have ever used in my life.

item.title: Amarok
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:7, topic:264681”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=349481.msg2687648#msg2687648 date=1235771620]

Reminds me of my favorite (windows) player, foobar.
Can you completely customize the GUI yourself?

Since it’s open source, technically yes. You can also change themes too which can alter how the player looks; so yeah.
[/quote]
In foobar, i can just right click on the ui, select modify ui (or w/e it is) and drag shit around and add things, is that possible in amarok?[/quote]

In 1.x, I don’t believe so.

Read full topic

Amarok is the best media player I have ever used. Initially, it was developed for the K User Environment (KDE), but since then it has moved to more mainstream operating systems such as Windows. A full list of supported Distributions & operating systems can be found: http://amarok.kde.org/wiki/Download

Hope I’ve shared some well-designed, open source software with this community.
